wiki.content:
"Sanctuary" (Shorter) 
 
 Recorded Columbia Studio B, New York City August 19, 1969
 
 Miles Davis - trumpet
 Wayne Shorter - soprano saxophone
 Bennie Maupin - bass clarinet
 Joe Zawinul - electric piano - Left
 Chick Corea - electric piano - Right
 John McLaughlin - electric guitar
 Dave Holland - bass
 Harvey Brooks - electric bass
 Lenny White - drum set - Left
 Jack DeJohnette - drum set - Right
 Don Alias - congas
 Juma Santos (credited as "Jim Riley") - shaker, congas
 
 On "Sanctuary" omit Maupin, Brooks and White
 
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary:
"Sanctuary" (Shorter)   Recorded Columbia Studio B, New York City August 19, 1969  Miles Davis - trumpet
 Wayne Shorter - soprano saxophone
 Bennie Maupin - bass clarinet
 Joe Zawinul - electric piano - Left
 Chick Corea - electric piano - Right
 John McLaughlin - electric guitar
 Dave Holland - bass
 Harvey Brooks - electric bass
 Lenny White - drum set - Left
 Jack DeJohnette - drum set - Right
 Don Alias - congas
 Juma Santos (credited as "Jim Riley") - shaker, congas  On "Sanctuary" omit Maupin, Brooks and White

track.name: Sanctuary
comments: i'll never forget the day i first listened to this album in 1970.   Miles and his mates blew this boy's mind.   And they do it to me every time.   Thanks to Billie Jay, KUDE radio in Oceanside back then for opening my ears to this music.  Magical times...
As expansive as the pacific ocean and as deep.
there is sure some bossa nove in there
Not for me, sorry. (I must have wrong ears or something.)
outstanding stuff. Yakuza definitely used some "sanctuary-influenced" tunes on their "01000011110011".
I've never been too sure about Miles' later, electric music, but this is pretty damn wonderful and makes me want to open my ears to some more of it.
One of our favourites. It's music.
the last couple minutes of this song are..passion.

"I'm always thinking about creating. My future starts when I wake up every morning . . .  Every day I find something creative to do with my life.”
- Miles Davis
